abstract: Rutgers University's joining of Big Ten college sports conference, move school hoped would bring in much-needed revenue, has instead brought mostly headaches along with spate of athletics-related scandals and firings; critics say mishaps, including firing of football coach Kyle Flood, stem from pressures and willingness to break rules to remain in Big Ten.
lead_paragraph: The tumult since the New Jersey state university gained membership in the sports conference in 2014 has made it an example of how colleges can go astray in a bid for prime-time athletics.

headline.main: Few Wins but Much Chaos at Rutgers After Move to the Big Ten
headline.print_headline: Few Wins but Much Chaos at Rutgers After Move to the Big Ten

snippet: The tumult since the New Jersey state university gained membership in the sports conference in 2014 has made it an example of how colleges can go astray in a bid for prime-time athletics.

keywords.value: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations
